channel.title: Networking on YING ZHEN LI
channel.description: Recent content in Networking on YING ZHEN LI

item.title: Networking
item.description: Primer on Latency and Bandwidth Latency - The time from the source sending a packet to the destination receiving it Bandwidth - Maximum throughput of a logical or physical communication path Notes Network data rates are typically measured in bits per second (bps), whereas data rates for non-network equipment are typically shown in bytes per second (Bps). This is a common source of confusion, pay close attention to the units.
